{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ectodermal dysplasia is a group of syndromes deriving from abnormalities of the ectodermal structures, which include the skin, hair, nails, teeth, and sweat glands. Hyperpyrexia, or extremely high fever, is not a typical symptom of ectodermal dysplasia. Protuberant lips and frontal bossing are not specific symptoms of ectodermal dysplasia. However, defective or absence of sweat glands is a common symptom of ectodermal dysplasia, as sweat glands are derived from the ectoderm.", "answer_choice": "C"}
